DOC.HEAD: Two Soldiers in Panama Will Come Home to Slightly Larger Families
DOC.TEXT: Special presents arrived Christmas Eve for two soldiers fighting supporters of deposed Gen. Manuel Noriega in Panama _ their wives each gave birth to a baby girl. There was some indication that both new fathers were hoping for future paratroopers, but one new mother took it in stride. ``We've got paratrooper women,'' Courtny Hollands, 26, said from her hosptial bed at Fort Bragg's Womack Army Community Hospital, where she gave birth to Lindsay Suzanne. Staff Sgt. Curtis Rosenbaum of the 82nd Airborne Division's 1st Squadron received a message Christmas Day about his new daughter, Ashley Ann, who was born to his wife, Becky. He called home to confirm the good news. ``He said, `Is it true? Is it true?''' said Mrs. Rosenbaum's mother, Linda Glidewell of Hico, Texas. Rosenbaum called his wife Saturday and found out she was in labor, Mrs. Rosenbaum, 22, said. ``He was going, `Can't you wait three weeks?''' she said. Mrs. Glidewell said she thinks her son-in-law was surprised that the child is a girl. ``I think they were expecting a boy because he wanted a paratrooper,'' she said. Capt. Dave Hollands, 29, of 3rd Battalion, 319th Artillery, was sent word Christmas Day about his daughter's birth, but Mrs. Hollands said she had not yet spoken with her husband. ``I did get a message sixth-hand (saying) `Did she have my son yet?' Typical man,'' she said. The babies were the first for both couples.
